information.title: Definition
information.description: Non-Constitutional bodies are organizations that are not specifically mentioned in the Constitution but are created by acts of Parliament or executive decisions to address specific needs or perform specialized functions.

information.title: NITI Aayog
information.description: Established in 2015 to replace the Planning Commission, it serves as a policy think tank and fosters cooperative federalism.

information.title: Central Vigilance Commission
information.description: Set up in 1964, it is the apex vigilance institution free of control from any executive authority, monitoring all vigilance activity and advising various authorities in central government organizations.

information.title: National Human Rights Commission
information.description: Established in 1993 under the Protection of Human Rights Act, it is responsible for the protection and promotion of human rights in India.

information.title: Central Information Commission
information.description: Created under the Right to Information Act 2005, it oversees the implementation of the RTI Act and serves as an appellate authority.

information.title: National Commission for Women
information.description: Established in 1992, it reviews the constitutional and legal safeguards for women, recommends remedial legislative measures, and advises the government on policy matters affecting women.

quizQuestions.question: Which of the following is a non-constitutional body?
Which body replaced the Planning Commission in 2015?
Under which Act was the National Human Rights Commission established?
Which commission oversees the implementation of the Right to Information Act?
In which year was the National Commission for Women established?
Non-Constitutional bodies are specifically mentioned in the Constitution of India.
The Central Vigilance Commission was established in 1964.
NITI Aayog serves as a policy think tank and fosters cooperative federalism.
The Central Information Commission was created under the Freedom of Information Act.
The National Commission for Women advises the government on policy matters affecting women.
